name: FormStatus (Messageboxes)
description: The FormStatus is a simple component meant for displaying the status of a form (errors, messages, etc.).

props.name: text
props.doc: The `text` appears as the status message. Beside plain text, you can send in a React component as well.

props.name: children
props.doc: The `text` appears as the status message. Beside plain text, you can send in a React component as well.

props.name: role
props.doc: The `role` attribute for accessibility, defaults to `alert`.

props.name: state
props.doc: Defines the visual appearance of the status. These are the statuses `error`, `warn`, `info` and `marketing`. The default status is `error`.

props.name: size
props.doc: Defines the appearance size. There are these sizes `default`, `large`. The default status is `default`.

props.name: icon
props.doc: The `icon` show before the status text. Defaults to `exclamation`.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: The icon size of the icon shows. Defaults to `medium`.

props.name: variant
props.doc: As of now, there is the `flat` and the `outlined` variant. Defaults to `flat`.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the FormStatus will be 100% in available `width`. **NB:** Only use this on independent status messages.

props.name: show
props.doc: Provide `false` if you want to animate the visibility. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: no_animation
props.doc: NB: Animation is disabled as of now. ~~use `true` to omit the animation on content visibility. Defaults to `false`.~~

props.name: shellSpace
props.doc: Use it to set an inner margin. It supports the same properties as [Space](/uilib/layout/space/properties). Useful for animation.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.
